entry.title: 7月23日
entry.content:
词汇–Chapter18-军事战争

英中英中
violence暴力conflict斗争
raid突袭enormity巨大，滔天大罪
campaign战役battle战斗
struggle挣扎
explosion爆发bombard轰击
bomb炸弹
blast爆炸burst爆裂
spark火星twinkle闪烁
gunpowder火药tank坦克
cannon大炮missile导弹
weapon武器pistol手枪

*

entry.title: 戒打牌时间（每日更新）
entry.content:
妈的我要戒balatro……
没几天几十个小时了……
学雅思的时间都没打牌多……
我求求你学点呢大姐……

entry.title: 7月22日
entry.content:
词汇–Chapter17-法律法规

英中英中
law法律法规legal法律的，合法的
rule规则，统治regulation规则，规定
item条目treaty条约，协议
agreement协定，同意==charter==宪章；租
==protocol==议定书，协议
norm标准==benchmark==基准，水准点
criteria标准，准则standard标准
permit允许allow允许
admission承认，入场
perform履行enforce强制执行
default不支付，不履行reject拒绝接受
constraint约束
official正式的，官方的==mandatory==法定的，强制的
==potent==很有效的，强力的bound一定会
==obligation==义务，责任
court法院supreme最高的，最大的
enact通过（法律）==legislate==立法
equity公平fair公平的
just公平的prejudice偏见
==discrimination==歧视accuse控告，指责
sue控告==prosecute==检举，起诉
==condemn==谴责，指责complain抱怨，投诉
==boycott==抵制，拒绝购买
==session==会议==mediate==斡旋，调解
==plea==借口，请求
appeal呼吁==contradict==反驳
persuade争议，辩论==controversy==争议，辩论
whisper低声说，mutter轻声低语
murmur低声说silent沉默的
==mute==哑的
investigation调查witness目击者，证人
justify为……辩护reasonable合理的
suitable合适的
judge法官==jury==陪审团
trial试验，审判suspect怀疑，嫌疑犯
sentence判决arrest逮捕，吸引（注意）
==jail==监狱，拘禁prison监狱
==confine==边界，范围
==oversee==监督==supervise==监督，管理
restrict限制，约束==restrain==抑制，阻止
==commit==犯罪==sin==罪孽
crime罪行，犯罪活动
==vice==恶行，缺点==bribe==贿赂
rob抢劫pirate海盗
steal偷窃thief窃贼
murder谋杀suiside自杀
==deceive==蒙骗cheat欺骗
==fraud==骗子；赝品liar说谎的人
trap陷阱trick诡计
pretend假装fool傻子
==stigma==耻辱，污名
confess供认，忏悔==conform==遵守，顺从
==reconcile==使和解，调和==obey==服从
==succumb==屈服
==penalty==惩罚fine罚款
==mortgage==抵押借款ownership所有权
copyright版权privilege特权
accredit把……归功于；委任
clue线索access通路
==anonymous==匿名的false错误的
genuine真诚的
procedure手续，程序routine常规
consequence后果
demand要求request要求
require需要，规定
==petition==请求，请愿书command命令，指挥
instruct指导

  • in default of—因为没有

  • They call for laws to promote gender equity.

  • be confined to—被局限于

    within the confines of —在（某范围）之内

    This is outside the confines of human knowledge.

  • virtue and vice are two different things: the former leads to peace, the latter to misery.

    vice versa—反之亦然

  • deceive sb into doing—骗某人做某事

  • social norms —社会准则

  • Her performances set a new benchmark for dancers throughout the world.—确立新准则

  • we have our own criteria for success

  • The piece of word doesn’t come up to your usual standard—达不到平时的标准

  • Those words hardly permit doubt.—不容置疑

  • enforce sth on sb—把某物强加在某人身上

  • feel constraint when in her presence—在她面前感到拘束

  • concerning—有关于

  • the medicine had a potent effect on your disease—对你的病很有效

  • he won the game fair and square—他堂堂正正地赢了这场比赛

  • prejudice against—对…… 的偏见

  • racial discrimination—种族歧视

  • mediate between —在……之间进行调解

  • make a plea for—恳求

  • lodge an appeal—提出申诉

  • your actions contradict our belief

  • investigation into

  • bear witness to—证明

  • suitable for

  • arrest sb’s attention

  • conform to —与……相符合

  • be reconciled with sb—与某人和解

  • obedient—服从的

  • subscribe to —订阅

    succumb to —屈服于

  • the privilege is abused—这一特权被滥用了

  • the invention of the electric light is accredicted to Edison—归功于

  • demanding—要求严格的

阅读

  • how the idea was carried out—想法是如何实现的

  • be under surveillance = monitor = supervision—在监视下

  • tragic—悲惨的

  • indication—象征

  • rigorous—谨慎的，细致的

    rigorous analysis—细致的分析
entry.summary: 词汇–Chapter17-法律法规

entry.title: IELTS speaking
entry.content:
[TOC]

  • homophonic—谐音词

  • pocket money

  • try it

  • celebrity

  • jump the queue—插队

  • decoration

  • pagoda—塔楼；

  • exhibition

PART2

unit7:describe a place

2. 常拍照的地方

a place where u have taken photos more than once

  • the small garden of our house, u can see it if you walk through the living room.
  • I used to take photos almost everyday when I was in highschool, but since I went to another city for study, I can hardly come back home. However, everytime I came back I will definitely take photos of it.
  • The photos show the growth of the plants in our garden, for example, when the roses and other flowers blossom, butterflies would come by and dance around them. Vegetables are also planted in the garden, like cucumbers and tomatoes.
  • The pjotos help me with my homesick when I was in anther city. They remind me of how time flies and we should value the time we spent with our family.

3. 物价贵的地方

  • Shanghai
  • south of the China, next to my province
  • I went there for sightseeing
  • food: bought a very ordinay bar of chocolate and it costs 88 yuan, which astonish me a lot. in my hometown …
  • transport: the transortation here is nt cheap as well. The public transportation is always very crowded but If you take a taxi,
  • houses: be famous for its house prices.It can be 5 times higher than that in my hometown, Most young people can’t afford a house and they have to rent a house instead. The renting is also high however.

4. 有趣但人少的景点

  • an ancient town, Anchang ancient town
  • far from the city. transportation is uncon, not so famous, seldom advertise it.
  • clear rivers and scented folwers
  • characterized by meat in a tasty sauce. u can
  • a store where u can get authentic tea with a low price
  • lucky enough to go there on festivals, there are local operas waiting for u. The whole world is decorated with the red color, energetic and possitive.
  • residents there also hang out hoists because Hoist and “f” are for the homophonic, so the name for blessing.

5. 自然景观

  • I’d like to talk about Jade Dragon Snow Mountain, an extraordinary natural landmark located in Yunnan Province, China.
  • I knew this place about 10 years ago when I went to Yunnan for sightseeing and searched on the internet for the destinations. Finally I chose this mountain after my research for the reason that it is is often considered one of the most picturesque spots in the region .
  • breathtaking sight ,
  • at the towering peaks, covered with permanent snow and , and you can see ancient glaciers via a cable car.
  • lower slopes , covered wth forests. in summer it burst into the sea of wild flowers.
  • u know it is a rare opportunity to see such varrious landscapes.
  • so i think it is a must-visit destination for anyone traveling to Yunnan Province.

6. 有趣的地方和朋友

  • a freind and we are both addicted to plants and glaciers.
  • we went there to
  • I’d like to talk about Jade Dragon Snow Mountain, an extraordinary natural landmark located in Yunnan Province, China.
  • rent a cable car to for sightseeing
  • I knew this place about 4 years ago when I went to Yunnan for sightseeing and searched on the internet for the destinations. Finally I chose this mountain after my research for the reason that it is is often considered one of the most picturesque spots in the region .
  • breathtaking sight.
  • at the towering peaks, covered with permanent snow and , and you can see ancient glaciers via a cable car.
  • lower slopes , covered wth forests. in summer it burst into the sea of wild flowers.
  • u know it is a rare opportunity to see such variable landscapes.
  • fans of plants and glaciers
  • so i think it is a must-visit destination for anyone traveling to Yunnan Province.

7. 小商店

  • the store called QIzhen educaional store next to my domitory in my school
  • I usually buy my breakfast and some living necceceties in the store in any case if I need something.
  • it offers hotdogs at midnight. If I study late at night, I will go to the store and buy one as a reward to my hardworking.
  • besides, when i don’t have enough time for my lunch or dinner, i will buy instant noodles. I usually ask the salesperson to add a fresh egg into it, which will cost extra 2 yuan.
  • it is convenient for its location and various products it served, but a little bit epensive than the supermarket. so if i have a lot of things to buy i will go to the supermarket outside the school.
  • also there r usually

8. 吵闹的地方

  • Kunming
  • I want to share my experience of how noise spoiled my trip to Kunming. As a native of Zhejiang, Kunming is way up west for me. However, it’s my best friend’s hometown, so I visited during last year’s summer holiday.
  • Sadly, what was meant to be a relaxing trip was ruined by loud noise. Actually, many people think
    Weihai is one of the most beautiful and attractive cities in China. It has a really good location because it’s surrounded by lakes, and there are lots of terrific attractions in the city. For example, Erhai is considered one of the best beaches in Asia. The water there is super clear and the sand is soft and white. Seeing groups of seagulls flying by is just an added bonus.
  • So, my original plan was to lounge on the beach with my girlfriend and simply unwind. But our peace was disrupted by groups of elderly people, energetically singing and dancing with loudspeakers and microphones. They were off-key and loud, filling the beach with their high-decibel performances. More frustratingly, they seemed to be everywhere, making it impossible to find a quiet spot to enjoy the waves.
  • Eventually, we left the beach within an hour. It was a letdown, especially since I had only a three- day break. You know, Weihai is definitely beautiful. The city is clean and green, with lots of trees and flowers everywhere. You can enjoy charming sea views almost anywhere you go. However, the constantnoise was a deterrent, making my holiday feel wasted.

9. 方便学习的室内室外场所

  • the seats beside the school library,
  • seats: it’s just opposite to a lake
  • offers socket.
  • use my laptop to write codes so the socket is a must for me
  • library: quieter but boring and depressing
  • see The lake reflected the golden light of the setting sun
  • Hear the birds singing
  • breath the fresh air
  • certainly feel relaxed and efficent

10.家里放松的地方

  • living room
  • just located in the center of the whole house on the first floor.
  • a sports area —buy facilities for yoga, strenthen muscle
  • a game region— play video games with my dad
  • certainly a TV area—watch TV with my mom
  • it is not the activities that entertain me, but the time spent with my family. The living room gave me a sense of living with my family.

11.历史建筑

  • the citywall in Shaoxing
  • stall—小摊
  • The Walls surround the city of Shaoxing to protect it from foreign enemies
  • built by bricks. orderly
  • grey, narrowly similar to the great wall
  • as high as 3 floors
  • covered with moss
  • a history of 2,500 years
  • now it is a tourist attraction and lots of tourist facilities are under constructioin.For example, a cafe nearby has been bulit, you can have a cup of coffee to release the tiredness.
  • the wisdom of the ancient people and their determination to defen their contry.
  • charming and fancinating

12. 空气污染的地方

  • an industrial zone manufacturing printed curcuit borad, namely PCB
  • about 2 km away from my home. near a river
  • about 7 years ago i moved to the house we are living now, and jogged around and i saw this zone.
  • why air polluted—the procedure involves melt plastic. Because of that, the smelly plastic and the coals burnt to heat the plastic are responsible for the air pollution.
  • breath in the air there can cause throatche sometimes
  • although the pullution have been reduced in recent year, it is still a resource of air puution and emit polluted gas.
  • I chose double E as my major partly because of this. I’m fed up with the pollution it caused and want to improve the processing of the PCB.

13. 想短期停留的地方

  • Shanghai
  • south of the China, next to my province
  • with my freind who is really a foodie and can always find fancinating food to eat
  • entertainments like Dysney and Universal Studios, I have longed for it for a long time
  • want to have a taste of the delicious-looking snacks I saw on Tiktok.
  • city streets are clean , the stores beside the streets are interesting so i think it is good for citywalk
  • althogh a developed city, the things are expensive so I don’t consider it an ideal place to live in for a long time.
  • for example,
  • transport: the transortation here is nt cheap as well. The public transportation is always very crowded but If you take a taxi,
  • houses: be famous for its house prices.It can be 5 times higher than that in my hometown, Most young people can’t afford a house and they have to rent a house instead. The renting is also high however.

14. 放松的地方

  • Well, I have always been very attached to the countryside. And I can totally relax when I am there. My grandparents live there and I went there last summer. It is just so peaceful and quiet,
    or you may say, it is tranquil. It slows everything down, and blocks out all the hustle and bustle
    of the city.
  • I go to the countryside every summer. It is easier for me to feel the beauty of nature when I
    am there. You can always find peace there. It’s not a cliché, I really feel so. I do.
  • In the countryside, you don’t need someone else to tell you spring is here. Instead, you get to see
    the little buds and the sprouting flowers. I mean, you can see the change of seasons, and it’s
    with your own eyes. Everything can be so natural, so real, and so tangible. It’s really relaxing.
    Last summer, when I was in the countryside, I found something even more meaningful and
    mentally relaxing: the bonds between people. I mean, people living in the city are always so
    busy. They are always buzzing around, never willing to spare a second to say hi. You can feel
    the distance between people. We are separated by endless traffic jams, by all the tall , fancy
    but boring buildings. But when I was in the countryside, things were totally different. The

you.

15. 翻新的设施

  • the table tennis gym in my school
  • it
  • used to be: narrow and shabby , only available to the staff and students
  • now: more tables and sports facilities, open to the public

unit8:describe a person

1. 爱买便宜物品的人

  • grandmother
  • raised by, so know her inside and out
  • buy fruits and vegetables with discounts in her daily routine. mainly in a small market beside her home
  • get up at 6:00a.m. to line up for the eggs with a half price
  • she still tighten her belt, although her retirement pay as a teacher is pretty high
  • remind me of using discounts when I shopped with her
  • save a large amount of money
  • always compare prices and products
  • grow up in difficult time. people of her generation went through a famine, so they r concious about their money
  • want the next generation to enjoy a better life, and that’s why she sting to this lifestyle.
  • look up to her, because she really shape my habits of purchasing

2. 鼓舞完成目标的人

  • my yoga coach, whose name is Monica. her muscle is in good shape which convince me of her ablity as a coach

  • i’m not a big fan of working out before, but i set a goal of losing 2 kilograms two months ago.

  • she is good at spliting the big goal into several doable steps. i mean, she gives me instructions , like what to eat everyday and what to do in her yoga class. for example, she says that i should not eat so much sugary food.

  • when i about to give up, always remind me of the importance of fitness and show me the acheivements of other students to raise my ambition.

  • besides, when i follow her professional instructions, she praise me to make me more confident about myself

  • she always says, you reap what you sow, which is really inspiring for me.

  • at last, i lose my weight from 47 kilograms to 45 kilograms

  • without her, i would not lose weight and strenthen my muscle so successfully and happily.

3. 喜欢一起学习的人

  • my roommate, intelligent and modest. in fact she is a top student in our school, and she won a lot of scholarships
  • the same major, choose the same class
  • in and after class.
  • go to the library early to find seats with sockets and study together
  • , lend books, share experiences
  • discuss about difficult tasks
  • in the domitory, we talk about some interesting things, like the singer we both like, to release the stress brought by whole day study

4. 青年榜样

  • elon musk
  • CEO of Tesla, an electronic car compeny, funder of SpaceX
  • i am not a big fan of cars but when i saw a car in a parking lot ten years ago, i talk to myself, wow, what car it is? the car is so cool and beautiful. i looked it up online and found that it was a tesla. that’s the first time i knew elon musk
  • in 2018 i saw a video that a rocket made by spacex was launched and this rocket carried the Tesla called roaster and there was an artificial man sitting in that car and they all carried into the outer space and it went all around the earth cycle by cycle.
  • there was a rock and roll song played on that car. i found it so cool because elon musk wanted to raise people’s attention of space exploration and he wants to explore outer space to find new places for human beings to live in the future
  • concerns about the future so much

5. 有趣的老人

  • a professor of our college, JIanxin shen, 62 years old but he is still looks young and charming.
  • teacher in motor modling
  • so interesting that can be described by one sentence.
  • firstly, obvious knowledgable. the funder of the subject and wrote the most important textbook in this field. strict to his students. and if u cannot reach his standard, just forget about graduation
  • however, he is also easy-going and open-minded. tell us the stories intead of the boring details of the motors. for example, he told us that he used to sell a motor 6 times higher than normal price simply because he covered the rotator with steel
  • I used to think he is fully concentrating to his academic work, but after an amazing afternoon i changed my mind. it was after his class. at that time i was playing rock and roll music in the classroom. he noticed me and we had a nice talk. we found that we share the same favorite rr band
  • well you know it is actually hard to imagine a 62 year old professor is interested in those noisy music. i really like him so i get a pretty high score in his class.

6. 很高兴认识的人

  • my roommate, first impression of her is that she is intelligent and modest. in fact she is a top student in our school, and she won a lot of scholarships. after living together for 2 years,

  • is easy to be happy,

  • have interesting ideas. do crazy thing: we went to a kara okay before the exam and study here for the whole night

  • made progress with her

  • the same major, choose the same class, sit together

  • in and after class.

  • go to the library early to find seats with sockets and study together

  • , lend books, share experiences

  • discuss about difficult tasks

  • in the domitory, we talk about some interesting things, like the singer we both like, to release the stress brought by whole day study

7. 喜欢的演员饰演的电影角色

  • Cillian Murphy
  • Oppenheimer in Oppenheimer
  • a famous scientist working for Manhattan Project
  • was an American theoretical physicist and the scientific director of the Manhattan Project, which developed the first nuclear weapons during World War II. He is often regarded as the “father of the atomic bomb.
  • the role is vivid, he has the
  • a scientist with academic achievements, own emotional life, relationship with his wife, struggle
  • how to get along with the government and gain support for his project
  • whether to create the weapon is a to be or not to be question for …, and for us audiences as well.
  • he chose movies carrfully and only act those fit him. his performance is fantastic and it feels like u r the scientist facing such a delemma and make your decision

8. 认识的小孩

  • wangyiyi, the son of my mom’s friend
  • about 1/mon
  • 12 years old, a little fat, wears glasses, naive cute
  • a foodie, give a good appetite
  • a little boy with great ambition, scientist, big fan of einstein
  • curious, ants to planets, good at asking questions
  • learn by himself after class
  • used to be addicted to video games, but he switch his attention to mathematic, so as to realise his dream
  • like him very much, but if he can eat less it would be better. i always spend too much on serving him a big meal every month.

9. 聚会上认识的人

  • a feind mine, Monica, a party of students’union
  • catch my eyes
  • like to talk to people have different life experiences and hobbies
  • fashion, in whole black, silver chain, dyed her hair red
  • good at taking photos, like interesting movies and novels that a few people know
  • have her ideas about the activities, advise to hold an academic salon which offers snacks and fruits
  • finally a huge success and become the tradition of our department
  • enjoyable
  • now we are the best freinds

10.重视并享受音乐的人

  • hanah, a friend , 1 year yonger than me

  • enthusiastic,

  • study music in Shanghai and study abroad

  • take the same class

  • show me the essays of music

  • major is piano

  • as main hobby, … also the direction of future career

  • enjoy life and

  • essays on musical opera, broaden my horizon, hard to understand

11. 有天赋的人

  • my brother, majoring in mathematics, studying aboard,

  • seemingly have no sense of art

  • burn to grab the painting brushes

  • good at Chinese painting

  • be sensitive to colors and the light

  • i learned with him, but can never catched his level, although i learned much harder.

  • the teacher regarded him as a genius , be proud of him

  • i was always overshadowed by him. and jealous of him

  • i think he is borned to paint, does not sting to this hobby, like calculating rather than painting.

  • a pity

12. 做了好决定的人

  • study abroad when he was in highschool
  • give up the chance to study in the best high school in our city
  • a large amount of money
  • i doubted wether it is a good choice but it finally turned out to be successful.
  • get high scores in ielts test by working hard
  • through effort he overcome the obstacle of language
  • finally he get into the …
  • now he is an intern student in a famous bank, and further his study in German

13. 健谈的人

When it comes to chatterboxes, I immediately think of the owner of a flower shop. The shop opened up near my home last year. It’s owned by an elderly woman who is in her sixties. Even though she’s older, she can talk your ear off, and I think that’s a big reason why her shop is doing well.

No matter who walks into her shop, she can strike up a conversation with them. It’s like she’s got a

never-ending supply of things to say. For example, the owner is a huge gardening enthusiast. To make the best use of those flowers and increase her income, she decided to teach flower arranging classes. Many people followed her to learn floral techniques and practice flower arrangement. What’s impressive is how she can talk non-stop in her classes. She can go into all the nitty-gritty details, and even after the class is done, she can just keep the conversation going, like talking about how physically demanding it is to arrange bouquets every day

Plus, the owner created a WeChat group where customers can ask any questions they may have about purchasing flowers or flower arranging. She often sends tons of voice messages to customers, each lasting for about 60 seconds, and she talks without taking many breaks. I truly respect her for having such a wealth of thoughts and ideas.

Anyways, her talkative nature is never bothersome. Instead, everyone finds her super sincere and enthusiastic. I especially admire her for that, and I believe her business will continue to thrive.

14. 好客的人

I’d like to talk about my mom’s friend, who is in her fifties and is just amazing at hosting guests.

Whenever someone visits her, she’s the kind of person who insists on going to the kitchen and whipping up something special. She lives on the ground floor and has a beautiful garden where she grows different vegetables and fruits. When guests are at her house, she always takes them to her little garden, lets them pick out the veggies they want, and then creates delicious meals for them.

Plus, when the weather is nice, she loves having friends and relatives over in her yard for barbecues

and parties. She personally takes charge of all the barbecue preparations. She even remembers everyone’s favorites, like who’s into garlic-grilled shrimp and who’s all about the sweet-flavored grilled shrimp. So, you don’t have to worry about being left out. She’s always there, making you feel super comfy and at home.

Anyways, her home always feels lively, and she often has lots of visits from friends and family. I think she’s an excellent host because she enjoys socializing. Besides, my mom said her friend honed her cooking skills at a very young age. Back then, her parents had to work away from home to make ends meet, so she had to learn to feed herself. She also worked in a school cafeteria for many years, which gaveher valuable experience.

So, for someone who can cook and loves cooking for others, it’s no surprise sheleaves a warm impression on people.

entry.title: IELTS writing skills
entry.content:
TASK1

动态题型分析

语料库P5

1. 趋势词汇

  1. 上升
    increase, rise, grow, jump, go up, climb, rocket
    increase, rise, growth, jump, climb, surge
  2. 下降
    decrease, decline, fall, drop, go down, plummet（暴跌，速降）, plunge（突然下降）
    decrease, decline, fall, drop
  3. 持平
    stay constant, remain stable
  4. 形容词
    sharp, rapid, quick, considerable, significant
    slight, slow
    steady, gradual, moderate

2. 趋势+最值

  1. 变化主体+趋势动词+副词+时间区间
    The number of aged people over 65 increased from 100 in 1940 to 200 in 2000, reaching its highest point/peak/top/lowest point/bottom

  2. There be+形容词+表示趋势的名词+in +变化主体+时间区间
    There was an increase in the number of aged people over 65 from 100 in 1940 to 200 in 2000.

  3. 时间作主语/横坐标作主语
    The period from 1940 to 2000 saw an increase in the number of aged people over 65 by 100. （by+差值）

3. 比较

  1. 两者：The number of A was/is/will be larger/higher/lower/smaller than that of B.
  2. 三者：The number of A was/is/will be the largest/highest/lowest/smallest in/among +范围（the +基数）

4. 交点

The number of A overtook that of B in 1990 (and that of C in 2000).

5. 连接词

  1. 段间：according to the first/second chart
  2. 句间-异线：
    • 并列：similarly, likewise, meanwhile, additionally
    • 转折：however, but, while, on the contrary, by contrast, on the other hand
  3. 句间-同线：
    and then, after that, from this point of onwards, in the next 20 years, in the rest years

文章结构

分段4-5段：开头+主体2-3段（线数小于等于3，每段一条；线数大于3，按首尾趋势分）+结尾

  • 描述对象：
    =名词（人/物）+定语
  • 描述内容：
    1. 时间区间+趋势变化
    2. 最值
    3. 比较
    4. 交点
  • 开头段:
    The graph/chart/table indicate/illustrate the number/figure/percentage/proportion/rate of A+时间/地点.

静态题型分析

​
​
​

  • plummet—暴跌，速降
    Share prices plummeted to an all-time low.股票价格暴跌到历史最低点。
  • plunge—突然下降
    Mexico’s economy suffered more than any other in Latin America last year, shrinking an estimated 7 percent due to a plunge in US demand for Mexican exports such as cars.
    去年墨西哥的经济比拉丁美洲的任何国家都遭受了更大的损失，估计经济萎缩7%，这是因为美国对墨西哥的出口商品，例如汽车的需求骤降。
  • respectively—各自地
entry.summary: TASK1

entry.title: IELTS reading skills
entry.content:
skills

雅思阅读方法全解|手把手教你做雅思阅读|9分阅读_哔哩哔哩_bilibili

  • 整理同义替换？

steps

预读题目、画关键词

顺序题

  • 填空（选词/图表），判断，单选
  • 预读两道画关键词

乱序题

  • heading, which paragrah contains 段落匹配，人名/国家/句子匹配
  • 阅读全文前预读题目画关键词

特殊题

  • 多选，选标题/副标题。
  • 多选题预读题目，选项后面读
    ==时间，数字，大写，人名定位画出，主旨词不用画==

读文章、定位关键词或同义替换

  • 读文章自动画出：转折（notwithstanding）、并列、因果、举例（例子前一般是重要观点）

解题

填空

  • 注意逻辑关系，主被动改写，词性，专有名词，
  • A and other B = B such as/including A

判断

  • **T:**同义替换+答案一致 / 跨段落总结
  • **F:**提及了但意思相反
  • NG:
    • 没有提及。特例：the first/only/major/most最高级；注意the most = more than all other
    • 提及内容，但其中关系（比较、因果）没提及。e.g. 原文A and B 题目A is more than B

vocabulary–538

7.15

resemble像like, look like, be similar to
recognize认出，识别perceive, acknowledge, realize, appreciate, admit, identify, understand, know
adjust调整，使适合change, modify, shift, alter
approach方法method, way
fundamental基本的，基础的rudimentary, preliminary（初步的）, basic
rely on依赖，依靠depend on
domestic家庭的，国内的home, local, national
measure测量calculate, assess, evaluate
trait特征characteristic, feature, property
coin创造first used, invent
artificial人造的synthetic, man-made
prompt促进，激起initiate, immediately
exchange交换share, apply A to B(把A涂在B上)
underlie成为……基础based on, ground, root
ignore忽视，不管neglect, overlook, underestimate
fertiliser肥料chemical, toxic, unnatural
thatthis, it, they, these, such
andor, as well as, both… and…, not only
thanks tostem from, derive, owing to, due to, acccording to, because of, on account of, as a result of, leading to
  • to coin a phrase—用老话来说
    No news is good news, to coin a phrase.
  • a principle that underlies all the party’s policies.贯穿该党各项政策的一条准则

7.17

entry.title: 7月13日
entry.content:
9

WRITING

TASK1

assignment

You should spend about 20 minutes on this task.
The line chart below shows the percentage of people in different age groups who played video games more than ten hours a week between 1984 and 2003.
Summarize the information by selecting and reporting the main features, and make comparisons where relevant.
Write at least 150 words.

example

​The chart above documents the results of a near-twenty year study of men who reported spending more than ten hours a week playing video games, taken between the years of 1984 and 2003 and divided between the ages of 7-14, 15-24, 25-34 and 35+.

​Generally, the chart shows an upward trend in acceptance of video games among men of this culture, while the age categories didn’t change position in relation to each other. 15-24 year olds played the most video games overall, with just under 20% in 1984 rising to 50% in 2003. Despite some rocky patches in the 90s, no-one enjoyed video games more than 15-24 year olds, although it looked like 7-14 year olds would in 1984, when they trailed 15-24 year olds by only a few percent. However, after a steady increase, around 35% said they enjoyed them in 2003. The 25-34 year olds valiantly tried to enjoy video games, with the closest other age groups getting being 1992.

​Finally, we have the over 35s, a group that started with a near 0% interest in games in 1984, but grew to 20% in 2003. One can only predict that as the current generation of gamers grows older, this number can only increase.

TASK2

assignment

You should spend about 40 minutes on this task.
Write about the following topic:
An increasing number of people change their career and place of residence several times during their lives.
Is this a positive or negative development?
Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
Write at least 250 words.

example

​In a world that has been radically changed as a result of mass communication and globalization, the ability—and need— of people to change residences and careers numerous times throughout their lives has been prominent in the current era. Personally, I see this as a liberating and beneficial practice.

​To be sure, there are certain drawbacks to moving residences and getting a new job too often. Adjusting to a new city and office can be stressful and time-consuming. It may also negatively affect job prospects if potential employers see that one is not particularly loyal enough to the company to stay on board. Finally, there is a certain level of financial stability required to afford down payments on houses or apartments when one changes locations multiple times in a given period.

​However, these difficulties do not detract from the sense of freedom and wealth of diverse experiences that one stands to gain from living in many different places and holding many different positions. For example, people who work abroad in various countries often learn about different cultures and become accustomed to working with different kinds of people more effectively. Similarly, frequently moving to different places teaches one to live more efficiently, giving one a better sense of budgetary control and necessary living standards.

​Considering the aforementioned points, I would assert that there are certainly factors that can negatively affect people changing jobs or homes too often. However, as long as they take the time to learn how to interact with people of various backgrounds, and how to live sparingly, this lifestyle proffers a net positive to one’s quality of life.

speaking

time

total: 11mins

part1: 4 mins3 topics11 questions25sec per question

Q1: Do you work or are you a student?

  • longer - about university? / 句式？

Q2

part2: 3mins=1min + 2min

  • make notes in English? - about cheating / ideas

part3: 3-12 questions

for YES:

for sureabsolutelydefinitelywithout doubtcertainly

for NO:

for sure notabsolutely notdefinitely notwithout doubt I don’tcertainly not

for because:

for the reason thatowing toas a result ofdue toall things considered

for AND:

alsoin additionfurthermoremoreoverwhat is morenot only … but also

for BUT:

howeveralthoughdespitein spite of

==never say maybe / perhaps==

rephrase

reword

9

entry.title: hello world!
entry.content:
很早以前就有想要自己经营一个blog的想法了，虽然我是一个菜鸡，没有那么多经验贴可以发，但是我垃圾话是一大堆。

原来很想去CC98开一个一路帖，但是我真的很i，不喜欢给陌生人展示自己的生活和废话，所以思来想去还是以blog这种朋友也能找到我，陌生人却比较难找到我的方式记录生活。

感谢妈妈赞助的78元域名注册费，虽然域名注册还在审核。即将以新的名字和大家见面啦！

很早以前就有想要自己经营一个blog的想法了，虽然我是一个菜鸡，没有那么多经验贴可以发，但是我垃圾话是一大堆。

原来很想去CC98开一个一路帖，但是我真的很i，不喜欢给陌生人展示自己的生活和废话，所以思来想去还是以blog这种朋友也能找到我，陌生人却比较难找到

entry.title: 剑雅16词汇
entry.content:
剑16

TEST 1

READING 1

  • humans with comparative levels of adipose

    adipose:脂肪的

  • diabetes

    糖尿病

  • shed light on this mystery

  • density

    密度

  • cholesterol

    胆固醇

  • mutation

    变异

  • genome

    人体基因组

  • osteoporosis

    骨质疏松

  • calcium

    钙

  • remodel

    重建，改造

  • nutrient availability

  • maternity

    怀孕，maternity ward 产科病房

  • den

    兽穴，a drinking/gambling den 酗酒窝点；赌窟

  • deplete

    大量减少；耗尽；使枯竭，Food supplies were severely depleted.

  • reserve

    预订，预约（座位、席位、房间等）；保留；贮备；拥有，保持，保留（某种权利）

  • dense

    密集的；稠密的 a dense crowd/forest 密集的人群；密林

  • resort

    旅游胜地；度假胜地；~ to sth：诉诸；求助；采取

  • mechanism

    机械装置；机件；方法；机制

  • primate

    灵长类；灵长目动物

  • anecdotal

    逸事的；趣闻的；传闻的

  • manipulate

    控制，操纵，影响；（熟练地）操作，使用

  • dislodge

    （把某物）强行去除，取出，移动；逐出，赶出，驱逐出

  • barrel

    啤酒╱葡萄酒桶

  • agile

    （动作）敏捷的，灵活的

  • sledge

    雪橇

  • remarkably, …

  • to the point where …

  • majestic

    雄伟的；威严的；壮观的

READING 2

  • monument

    纪念碑（或馆、堂、像等）

  • tribute

    （尤指对死者的）致敬，颂词；悼念；致哀；吊唁礼物;

    ~ to sth/sb:良好效果或影响的）体现，显示

  • reign

    任期；当政期

  • rectangular

    长方形的

  • deceased

    死去了的；已死的；亡故的

  • conceive of

    设想 We conceive of the family as being in a constant state of change.

  • stack

    一叠，一摞，一堆

  • slab

    厚板；厚块 a slab of chocolate

  • experimentation

    实验；试验；尝试

  • courtyard

    （通常为城堡、大宅第等的）庭院，院子，天井

  • shrine

    圣地；圣祠；神庙；神龛；Wimbledon is a shrine for all lovers of tennis. 温布尔登是所有网球爱好者的圣地。

  • hectares

    公顷

  • trench

    沟；渠；战壕；堑壕

  • incorporate

    ~ sth (in/into/within sth) 将…包括在内；包含；吸收；使并入

    Many of your suggestions have been incorporated in the plan. 你的很多建议已纳入计划中。

  • chamber

    会议厅；（作特定用途的）房间，室；

  • maze

    迷宫；纷繁复杂的规则；复杂难懂的细节

  • inscribe

    ~ A (on/in B)~ B (with A) 在…上写（词语、名字等）；题；刻

  • excavate

    发掘，挖出（古建筑或古物）

  • predecessor

    前任

  • dump

    （尤指在不合适的地方）丢弃，扔掉，倾倒

  • intricate

    错综复杂的

  • It can be said without exaggeration that … constitutes a milestone in the evolution of … in Egypt and in the world as a whole.

READING 3

  • disruptive

    引起混乱的；扰乱性的；破坏性的

  • legitimate

    正当合理的；合情合理的;合法的；法律认可的；法定的

  • scenario

    设想; 可能的情况

  • transition

    转型

  • trajectory

    轨道，弹道，轨迹

  • pension

    养老金；退休金；抚恤金

  • fallacy

    谬见；谬论；谬误 It is a fallacy to say

  • redundancy

    （因劳动力过剩而造成的）裁员，解雇;多余；累赘

    Natural language is characterized by redundancy. 自然语言的特点就是啰嗦。
entry.summary:
剑16

<
